name: Rackspace Customer Portal (Fabric)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Rackspace customer management portal built on Fabric automation platform. Primary self-service interface for managed cloud customers. DNS: portal.rackspace.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com, DNS records.

name: Cloud Control Panel
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Web-based GUI for managing all Rackspace cloud resources at mycloud.rackspace.com. Product areas: Servers, Orchestration, Networking, Storage, Databases, and Backups. Supports gear-icon actions, tag-based filtering, and RBAC-controlled access per user. Also accessible via login.rackspace.com unified portal. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/introducing-the-rackspace-cloud-control-panel, docs.rackspace.com/docs/manage-a-cloud-server.

name: Cloud Office Control Panel
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Cloud Office administration portal for email, Exchange, collaboration management. DNS: cp.rackspace.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-office.

name: Cloud Office Webmail Portal
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Browser-based webmail access for Cloud Office email customers. DNS: apps.rackspace.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-office.

name: Cloud Identity Service (Keystone)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] OpenStack Keystone identity service powering Rackspace Cloud authentication. Token-based auth, service catalog, RBAC. API: identity.api.rackspacecloud.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/reference/identity-concepts.

name: Cloud Servers API (Nova)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] OpenStack Nova compute API. Provisions and manages cloud server instances across DFW, IAD, ORD, LON, SYD, HKG regions. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-servers.

name: Cloud Files Object Storage (Swift)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] OpenStack Swift object storage. CDN-integrated file storage with Akamai delivery. DNS: storage101.{dcid}.clouddrive.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-files.

name: Cloud DNS API
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Globally-distributed Anycast DNS service with servers in Texas, Virginia, Illinois, and London. No single point of failure per data center. REST API at dns.api.rackspacecloud.com (US) and lon.dns.api.rackspacecloud.com (UK). Supports domain CRUD, BIND9 import/export, full TTL control, and custom record types. Available at no additional cost to Cloud account holders. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackspace-cloud-dns-overview, docs.rackspace.com/reference/rackspace-cloud-dns-api-10.

name: Cloud Databases API
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Managed DBaaS API supporting MySQL, MariaDB, Percona, PostgreSQL. Regional endpoints. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-databases.

name: Cloud Load Balancers API
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Cloud load balancer management API for traffic distribution. Regional endpoints. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-load-balancers.

name: Cloud Networking API (Neutron)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] OpenStack Neutron network management API. Virtual networks, subnets, ports, security groups. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-networks.

name: Rackspace Monitoring API
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Cloud monitoring API for infrastructure health checks and alerting. DNS: monitoring.api.rackspacecloud.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-monitoring.

name: Mailgun Transactional Email Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Rackspace-owned transactional email platform. Email delivery APIs, SMTP relay, analytics. DNS: smtp.mailgun.org. Source: mailgun.com, DNS records.

name: ObjectRocket DBaaS Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Managed DBaaS platform supporting MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, CockroachDB. DNS: app.objectrocket.com. Source: objectrocket.com product pages, DNS records.

name: AS12200 BGP Edge Router Cluster
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Primary BGP edge router cluster for AS12200 (Rackspace global backbone). 5 upstream transit peers. Source: ARIN WHOIS, PeeringDB AS12200.

name: AS33070 DFW Edge Routers
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] BGP edge routers for AS33070 serving DFW metro data centers (DFW1/DFW3). Source: ARIN WHOIS, PeeringDB AS33070.

name: AS27357 IAD Edge Routers
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] BGP edge routers for AS27357 serving Ashburn/Herndon VA (IAD1/IAD2/IAD3). Source: ARIN WHOIS, PeeringDB AS27357.

name: AS19994 ORD Edge Routers
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] BGP edge routers for AS19994 serving Chicago ORD data center. Source: ARIN WHOIS, PeeringDB AS19994.

name: AS15395 LON Edge Routers
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] BGP edge routers for AS15395 serving London data centers (LON3/LON5/LON8). Source: ARIN WHOIS, RIPE DB.

name: Authoritative DNS Cluster (Anycast)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Anycast authoritative DNS cluster. DNS: ns.rackspace.com, ns2.rackspace.com. Serves rackspace.com and customer zones. Source: DNS dig records.

name: Cloud DNS Resolvers (stabletransit.com)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Cloud DNS resolver infrastructure. DNS: dns1.stabletransit.com, dns2.stabletransit.com. Source: DNS dig records.

name: Cloud Office DNS (name-services.com)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Cloud Office DNS infrastructure. DNS: dns1-5.name-services.com. Source: DNS dig records, WHOIS.

name: RackConnect Global MPLS Control Plane
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T5] RackConnect Global MPLS control plane. Private multi-cloud interconnect to AWS, Azure, GCP via Equinix Fabric and Megaport. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackconnect.

name: RackConnect Megaport Exchange Gateways
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T5] RackConnect gateway nodes at Megaport exchange points. Vendor: vnd-013. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackconnect.

name: RackConnect Equinix Exchange Gateways
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T5] RackConnect gateway nodes at Equinix exchange facilities. Vendor: vnd-012. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackconnect.

name: DC Management Plane (DCIM/IPMI)
description: [CONFIRMED - T4] Data Center Infrastructure Management covering DCIM and IPMI/BMC for hardware lifecycle across 27+ DCs. Source: rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Physical Security Systems (PACS)
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T4] Physical access control: biometric readers, badge access, mantrap entry, 24x7x365 CCTV. Source: rackspace.com/compliance, SOC 3 FY2024.

name: Environmental Monitoring (BMS)
description: [CONFIRMED - T4] Building management system: N+1 UPS with dual power, N+2 chiller, fire suppression, flood detection across 27+ DCs. Source: rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Rackspace Infrastructure Automation Toolbox
description: [CONFIRMED - T6] Infrastructure automation toolbox container (gcr.io/rs-public-containers/rackspace-toolbox). Bundles Terraform, Ansible, cloud CLIs. Source: GitHub rackspace-infrastructure-automation.

name: Rackspace Monitoring Agent Fleet
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Distributed monitoring agent fleet deployed across customer and internal infrastructure. Reports to monitoring.api.rackspacecloud.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-monitoring.

name: Rackspace Email Hosting Platform (emailsrvr.com)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Rackspace-branded email hosting platform. POP/IMAP/SMTP for hosted email customers. DNS: emailsrvr.com. Source: DNS records, docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-office.

name: Cloud Email Admin API
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Cloud Office email administration API. DNS: api.emailsrvr.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-office.

name: Cloud Control Panel Backend (stabletransit.com)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Backend infrastructure for Cloud Control Panel. DNS: clcp-n01.stabletransit.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Rackspace Corporate Website (AWS-hosted)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Corporate website hosted on AWS (CloudFront CDN). DNS: www.rackspace.com. Source: DNS dig, HTTP headers.

name: Cloud Files CDN Edge Network
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Content delivery network using global edge servers to reduce website latency. Powered by Akamai CDN partnership. Static content served from Cloud Files containers via CDN-enabled URLs. Integrated with Cloud Control Panel for CDN management. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/choose-a-rackspace-backup-solution (Cloud Files reference), rackspace.com product documentation.

name: Cloud Files Auth Service
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Authentication service for Cloud Files storage. DNS: auth.clouddrive.com. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-files.

name: ObjectRocket Self-Hosted DNS
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Self-hosted DNS for ObjectRocket DBaaS. DNS: dfw3dns1.objectrocket.com, iad2dns0.objectrocket.com. Source: DNS records.

name: ObjectRocket Elasticsearch Service
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Managed Elasticsearch service under ObjectRocket. DNS: es.objectrocket.com. Source: objectrocket.com.

name: ObjectRocket Container Registry
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Container image registry for ObjectRocket. DNS: registry.objectrocket.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Bomgar Remote Support Gateway
description: [CONFIRMED - T7/T9] BeyondTrust (Bomgar) remote support gateway for Fanatical Support. DNS: bomgar.rackspace.co.uk. Vendor: vnd-028. Source: job postings, DNS records.

name: DDoS Mitigation Cluster (Arbor/Cisco Guard)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] DDoS mitigation using Arbor Networks/Cisco Guard. DNS: arbor-dfw.dfw3.rackspace.net. 4 transit providers enable traffic shifting. Source: DNS records, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Bastion Host Cluster
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T9] Bastion host cluster for privileged admin access. Session recording via Balabit/BeyondTrust. DNS: secure-bastion.dfw1.rackspace.com. Source: SOC 3 FY2024, DNS records.

name: Network TACACS+ AAA Servers
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T9] TACACS+ AAA servers for network device management. DNS: tacacs1.lon.rackspace.com. Source: SOC 2/3, DNS records.

name: VPN Gateway Cluster
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T9] VPN gateway cluster for remote access. MFA via RSA tokens. DNS: vpn1.iad1.rackspace.com. Source: SOC 3 FY2024, DNS records.

name: Caching DNS Resolver Fleet
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Caching DNS resolver fleet for internal resolution. DNS: cachens1.lon.rackspace.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Datapipe Legacy DNS Infrastructure
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Legacy DNS from 2017 Datapipe acquisition. DNS: ns1.datapipe.net. Source: DNS WHOIS.

name: Corporate Syslog Aggregation
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Centralized syslog aggregation. DNS: syslog-1.iad1.rackspace.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Network Monitoring Cluster (RackWatch/MRTG)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Legacy network monitoring (RackWatch/MRTG). DNS: rackwatch.iad1.rackspace.com. Source: DNS records.

name: eTrust Antivirus Server
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Legacy antivirus server. DNS: etrustserver.rackspace.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Infrastructure Provisioning (RHN/Kickstart/Mirror)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Server provisioning: RHN Satellite, Kickstart, package mirrors. DNS: mirror.rackspace.co.uk. Source: DNS records.

name: ObjectRocket IPAM (SJC)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] IP address management for ObjectRocket SJC. DNS: sjcipam.sjc.objectrocket.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Security Scanning Infrastructure
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Security vulnerability scanning infrastructure. DNS: seconly.rackspace.com. Source: DNS records.

name: Site Firewall Clusters
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T9] Perimeter firewall clusters at each DC site. DNS: fw1.iad1.rackspace.com. Source: SOC 2/3 FY2020-2024, DNS records.

name: Rackspace Monitoring Infrastructure (mon.rackspace.co.uk)
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] UK-based monitoring infrastructure. DNS: mon.rackspace.co.uk. Source: DNS records.

name: Rackspace AI Security Engine (RAISE)
description: [CONFIRMED - T5] AI-powered security detection engine. Threat intelligence correlation with operational data. Source: rackspace.com/security, press releases.

name: Rackspace Managed Cloud Platform (RMC)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Unified AI-enabled framework for hybrid/multicloud workload operations. Launched August 5, 2025 as next-gen upgrade to Rackspace Cloud Management Platform. Single pane of glass for managing AWS, Azure, GCP, and private cloud workloads. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom (Aug 2025 CMP launch announcement).

name: Rackspace AI Business Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Enterprise AI-optimized hybrid cloud platform announced March 25, 2025. Built on NVIDIA AI Enterprise, HPE ProLiant servers with NVIDIA H100/H200 GPUs and InfiniBand networking. Provides distributed training, scalable inferencing, and fine-tuning capabilities. Integrates Run:AI GPU orchestration for workload scheduling. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom (March 2025 press release), rackspace.com/cloud/private/ai-business.

name: FAIR MCP Enterprise Accelerator
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Global AI practice platform at fair.rackspace.com providing Ideate, Incubate, and Industrialize methodology for enterprise AI transformation. FAIR (Foundry for AI by Rackspace) celebrated 1st anniversary with 150+ Rackers using ICE and 600+ using RITA. Supports all Rackspace AI product launches including AI Anywhere, AI Business, and AI Launchpad. Source: fair.rackspace.com, rackspace.com/newsroom (FAIR 1st anniversary press release Sep 2024).

name: Atlassian Jira
description: [CONFIRMED - T7/T8] Project management and issue tracking. Sprint planning, incident tracking, change management workflows. Vendor: vnd-019 (Atlassian). Source: Job postings referencing Jira, LinkedIn profiles, vendor confirmed in L10.

name: Atlassian Confluence
description: [CONFIRMED - T8] Enterprise wiki and knowledge management. Technical runbooks, architecture docs, team collaboration. Vendor: vnd-019 (Atlassian). Source: LinkedIn profiles referencing Confluence documentation workflows.

name: Splunk Enterprise Security SIEM
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] SIEM platform. 13-month log retention. Predefined correlation rules for threat detection. Ingests from AD, firewalls, IDS, endpoints. Vendor: vnd-018 (Splunk/Cisco). Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — explicit SIEM reference with 13-month retention.

name: Salesforce CRM Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T5/T8] CRM platform. Sales pipeline, opportunity management, account records. RelationEdge (Salesforce consultancy) acquired 2018 confirms deep investment. Vendor: vnd-020. Source: 2018 acquisition press release, LinkedIn profiles.

name: Slack Enterprise Messaging
description: [CONFIRMED - T8] Enterprise messaging and collaboration. Real-time communication across engineering, operations, support. Source: LinkedIn profiles referencing Slack as primary communication tool.

name: Microsoft 365 Suite
description: [CONFIRMED - T7] Enterprise productivity: Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive. 25+ year Microsoft partnership. Vendor: vnd-002. Source: Job postings referencing 'Office 365' and 'Windows Desktops'.

name: SailPoint IdentityIQ
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] Governance-based IAM platform. Automated access certifications, policy management, access request and provisioning, password management. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 (Oct 2023-Sep 2024) — 'SailPoint IdentityIQ (IIQ) – governance-based identity access management (IAM) solution that provides automated access certifications, policy management, access request and provisioning, password management.'

name: CrowdStrike Falcon Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T5] Next-gen antivirus, EDR, cyber threat intelligence. IR partner during Dec 2022 Play ransomware incident (CVE-2022-41080). Vendor: vnd-014. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — 'CrowdStrike Falcon Intel - provides next-generation antivirus, endpoint detection and response, and cyber threat intelligence.' Also: Dec 2022 8-K filing.

name: Palo Alto Networks IDS/IPS
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] Network and application layer intrusion detection. Vendor: vnd-015. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — 'Intrusion Detection System (IDS) - Palo Alto network devices are utilized primarily to perform advanced traffic inspection (inclusive of both network layer and application layer inspection) to detect malicious activity.'

name: RSA Authentication Manager
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] MFA platform providing hardware tokens with rolling PINs. Enforced for VPN, bastion, privileged access. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — 'Rivest, Shamir, Adelman (RSA) – RSA authentication manager is utilized as the means to provide tokens with rolling personal identification numbers (PIN) codes to enable multi-factor authentication in the Rackspace environment.'

name: BeyondTrust Privileged Session Management
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] Bastion host session recording and privileged access management. Application-layer filtering, MFA enforcement, environment isolation. Vendor: vnd-028 (BeyondTrust/Bomgar). Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — 'NextGen Bastion Hosts – Balabit shell control box appliances are utilized to provide application layer filtering and proxying of connections into in-scope environments, enforcing multi-factor authentication and creating isolation between in-scope and out-of-scope environments.'

name: Trend Micro Cloud One Workload Security
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] File integrity monitoring (FIM) and log inspection. Monitors critical system files, registry keys, configurations for unauthorized changes. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — 'Trend Micro Cloud One - Workload Security (TRND) - SaaS based file Integrity monitoring (FIM) and log inspection.'

name: Active Directory 3-Forest Architecture
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] Three-forest AD deployment: Corporate (employee accounts), Intensive (privileged/admin accounts), Global RS (service accounts, customer environment management). SOC 2 FY2020 references 'Corporate Active Directory synchronizes with the GPS system every night.' Source: SOC 2/3 FY2020-2024.

name: Active Directory Federation Services
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] Federated identity/SSO bridging 3-forest AD to cloud SaaS (M365, Salesforce, ServiceNow, Workday). Source: SOC 2/3 FY2020-2024 — referenced in authentication architecture.

name: Vulnerability Management (Microsoft Defender VMDR)
description: [INFERRED - 0.85] Vulnerability management and detection integrated within the Microsoft Unified SecOps platform. Rackspace blog (Oct 2025) confirms VMDR is part of their unified security operations alongside SIEM, SOAR, XDR, and EDR. Job postings reference vulnerability scanning as a core capability. Source: rackspace.com/blog/shift-unified-security-platforms, Rackspace Cyber Defence job postings (Lever).

name: Web Application Firewall
description: [INFERRED - 0.80] Web application firewall protecting Rackspace customer-facing portals and APIs. Rackspace Cyber Defence job postings (Lever) list WAF expertise with Cloudflare, Akamai, and Azure WAF. Rackspace security strategy page references WAF as part of their security operations. Specific internal WAF vendor not publicly disclosed. Source: jobs.lever.co/rackspace Security Engineer L3 posting.

name: Data Loss Prevention (Microsoft Purview / Symantec)
description: [INFERRED - 0.85] Data loss prevention platform protecting sensitive data across Rackspace environments. Rackspace Cyber Defence job postings (Lever) list DLP tools: Microsoft Purview, McAfee, and Symantec as required experience. Microsoft Purview aligns with Rackspace M365/Sentinel-centric security stack. Source: jobs.lever.co/rackspace Security Engineer L3 (Cloud Security) and Security Engineer L3 (Endpoint Security) postings.

name: Email Security Gateway (Proofpoint / Microsoft Defender for Office)
description: [INFERRED - 0.85] Email security gateway protecting Rackspace corporate and customer email flows. Rackspace Cyber Defence L3 (Endpoint Security) job posting lists email security tools: Proofpoint, Mimecast, and Microsoft Defender for Office. Given Rackspace M365 Suite (sys-068) deployment, Microsoft Defender for Office 365 is the most likely primary platform. Source: ninjajobs.org/job Rackspace Security Engineer L3 (Endpoint Security).

name: Kubernetes Clusters (Kubespray)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3/T9] Multi-cluster Kubernetes deployed via Kubespray 2.27.0. Underpins Genestack (OpenStack-Helm), UnderStack (Ironic bare metal), and internal services. Kube-OVN CNI, MetalLB load balancing, Rook Ceph persistent storage. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com release notes — 'Kubernetes 1.30.x and Kubespray 2.27.0'; github.com/rackerlabs/genestack; github.com/rackerlabs/understack.

name: Ansible Automation Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Configuration management and Kubespray orchestration. Genestack uses Ansible playbooks for host setup, Kubespray cluster deployment, and service configuration. Inventory at /etc/genestack/inventory. Source: github.com/rackerlabs/genestack bootstrap.sh — 'requires ansible, ansible collection and helm'; docs.rackspacecloud.com/k8s-kubespray.

name: Helm Package Manager
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Kubernetes package management for OpenStack-Helm charts, Prometheus Operator, cert-manager, Grafana, Loki, and 30+ service deployments. Centralized version pinning via helm-chart-versions.yaml. Source: github.com/rackerlabs/genestack — 'crafted with Kustomize and Helm'; docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: Terraform Enterprise
description: [CONFIRMED - T7/T9] Infrastructure-as-code for multi-cloud provisioning (AWS, Azure, OpenStack). Terraform provider for Rackspace Spot published on Terraform Registry. Job postings require 'Infrastructure deployment via Terraform (IAM, networking, security).' Source: github.com/rackerlabs/terraform-provider-spot; Rackspace Azure DevOps Engineer job posting (Himalayas).

name: GitHub Enterprise/Organizations
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Primary source control. Multiple orgs: rackerlabs (119+ public repos — Genestack, UnderStack, Terraform providers), rackspace-org (Jenkins X repos, EKS+Vault). Job postings reference 'Git Flow, GitHub' and 'design/implement group development collaboration process.' Source: github.com/rackerlabs; github.com/rackspace-org; job postings.

name: GitHub Actions CI/CD
description: [CONFIRMED - T7/T9] CI/CD pipeline automation integrated with GitHub repositories. Job postings require 'CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.' Genestack Terraform workflow detected in repo structure. Source: Rackspace Azure DevOps Engineer job posting — 'Implement and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions'; github.com/rackerlabs repo CI patterns.

name: GitHub Container Registry (GHCR)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Container image registry for Genestack OpenStack service images. Images published as ghcr.io/aedan/genestack-images/*. Stores Keystone, Nova, Heat, Glance, Cinder images. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com upgrade guide — image tags referencing 'ghcr.io/aedan/genestack-images/heat:2025.1-1750442748'.

name: Harbor Container Registry
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] On-premises container registry for AI/GPU workloads. Hosts custom Docker images for CUDA, Jupyter, vLLM, Triton Server for Run:AI deployments. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/registry-image-library — 'Custom Docker images optimized for AI development... readily available in our Harbor Registry'; docs.rackspace.com/docs/runai-harbor.

name: Docker Container Runtime
description: [CONFIRMED - T7/T9] Container runtime across production and development environments. Job postings require Docker expertise. Genestack and UnderStack build processes reference Docker images. Source: Rackspace DevOps job postings; github.com/rackerlabs/genestack Dockerfiles.

name: Kustomize
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Kubernetes manifest customization used as Helm post-renderer in Genestack. kustomize.sh scripts in /etc/genestack/kustomize/. Source: github.com/rackerlabs/genestack — 'crafted with Kustomize and Helm'; docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files — 'kustomize.sh script... used as a post-renderer in Helm deployments.'

name: Prometheus Monitoring (Operator)
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Kubernetes-native monitoring deployed via Prometheus Operator. System monitoring and alerting for Genestack/OpenStack infrastructure. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com release notes — 'Prometheus monitoring with the Prometheus Operator... used for system monitoring and alerting.'

name: Grafana Dashboards
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Visualization and dashboarding for Prometheus metrics. Deployed via Helm chart (v9.2.2) in Genestack. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files — helm-chart-versions.yaml lists 'grafana: 9.2.2'.

name: Loki Log Aggregation
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Centralized log aggregation for Kubernetes workloads. Upgraded past v6 in latest Genestack release requiring new Helm overrides. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com release notes — 'The loki service is being upgraded past version 6.'

name: Rook Ceph Persistent Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Kubernetes PVC storage backend. Supports both internal (in-cluster) and external Ceph deployments. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com release notes — 'Rook Ceph can be deployed internal to the Kubernetes cluster to provide persistent storage options.'

name: Kube-OVN CNI Plugin
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Kubernetes container network interface providing networking services. Migrated from Kubespray-managed to Helm-managed (v1.13.14) deployment. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com release notes — 'Kube-OVN CNI plugin is supported... kube-ovn: v1.13.14'; migration documentation at k8s-cni-kube-ovn-helm-conversion.

name: ServiceNow ITSM Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - T9/T3] Enterprise IT service management. Domain rackspace.service-now.com confirmed. System status page at /system_status. Integrates with Jira (sys-063), Salesforce (sys-066), Splunk (sys-065), SAP, Slack (sys-067), email, and 'Rackspace Technology Core Ticketing System.' Source: rackspace.service-now.com (live domain); rackspace.com/applications/servicenow — integration list; ServiceNow Community forum incident referencing SNOW↔Rackspace integration.

name: Rackspace Core Ticketing System
description: [CONFIRMED - T3] Legacy/proprietary ticketing system referenced as distinct from ServiceNow. ServiceNow page explicitly lists 'the Rackspace Technology Core Ticketing System' as an integration target alongside Jira, Salesforce, Splunk. Likely internal system for customer support ticket management predating ServiceNow adoption. Source: rackspace.com/applications/servicenow — 'integrate your instance with your other mission-critical systems like JIRA, Salesforce, Splunk, SAP, Slack, email, the Rackspace Technology Core Ticketing System.'

name: Workday HCM Platform (Global People System)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Workday human capital management platform serving as Rackspace global HRIS. Lever job posting for Manager, HR Technology (Workday) confirms Workday is the core platform for Core HR, Time and Absence, Benefits, Payroll, and HR Ticketing. Managed by dedicated HR Technology team with Jira and ServiceNow project tracking. Supports 7,200+ employee lifecycle management globally. Source: jobs.lever.co/rackspace/616a7e09 (Manager, HR Technology Workday).

name: Lever Applicant Tracking System
description: [CONFIRMED - T9] Applicant tracking and recruitment platform. Job postings served from jobs.lever.co/rackspace domain. Manages hiring pipeline for ~7,200 employee organization across global offices. Source: jobs.lever.co/rackspace (live domain, all current job postings).

name: Avaya Unified Communications
description: [CONFIRMED - T7] Enterprise telephony and unified communications. Supports 'Fanatical Support' model with 24x7x365 customer support across global call centers. Vendor: vnd-029 (Avaya). Source: Job postings referencing Avaya expertise; Rackspace support phone numbers (1-800-961-4454, international numbers via my.rackspace.com/portal/auth/phone).

name: Billing & Revenue Management System
description: [CONFIRMED - T2/T4] Enterprise billing platform for $2.7B revenue. Supports usage-based, subscription, and hybrid billing across dedicated hosting, public cloud, managed services. MyRackspace portal exposes billing views to customers. Source: SOC 3 FY2024 — MyRackspace portal for 'account information regarding their Rackspace services'; 10-K FY2024 revenue recognition requirements; rackspace.com/compliance (PCI DSS Level 1 for payment processing).

name: Cisco ACS/ISE Network Access Control
description: [CONFIRMED - T2] TACACS+ authentication for network device access. Controls who can create/modify configurations on hypervisors, firewalls, network devices, and ACS policies itself. Source: SOC 2 FY2020 — 'users with the ability to create or modify configurations on in-scope hypervisors, firewalls, network devices, and Cisco ACS policies'; SOC 3 FY2024 confirms TACACS+ for network device authentication.

name: Zerto IT Resilience Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Hypervisor-based continuous data replication platform for SDDC Business and Enterprise customers. Provides premium-tier DR with continuous data protection, near-zero RPO, Virtual Protection Groups (VPGs) for application-level failover, and journal-based recovery. Zerto Virtual Manager (ZVM) integrates with vCenter for authentication. Configurable per-VM network mapping for failover/test scenarios. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/zerto-disaster-recovery.

name: Rubrik Cyber Recovery Cloud
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Air-gapped isolated recovery environment (IRE) powered by Rubrik for cyber recovery. Joint announcement at RSAC April 2025 with Rubrik. Provides immutable backup vault with anomaly detection, automated recovery testing, and ransomware investigation capabilities. Available as add-on for Rackspace private cloud customers. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom (April 2025 RSAC press release), rubrik.com partnership announcement.

name: VMware vCenter Server
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Centralized management console for VMware vSphere virtualized infrastructure across RPC-VMware and SDDC Enterprise deployments. Core to Workload Domain (WLD) architecture in VMware Cloud Foundation. Each WLD has dedicated vCenters joined via Enhanced Linked Mode for single-pane-of-glass management. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/add-ons (VVD/WLD architecture description).

name: VMware Cloud Director Availability (VCDA)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Initial-tier DR service for SDDC Business and Enterprise customers providing interval-based VM replication between vCenter sites. Integrated with vSphere Replication (sys-117) for basic replication capabilities. Lower-cost alternative to Zerto premium tier. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/add-ons.

name: VMware vSphere Replication
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Hypervisor-based asynchronous replication solution natively integrated with vCenter Server and vSphere Web Client. Used in conjunction with VMware Site Recovery Manager for DR orchestration. Supports any vSphere-compatible storage. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/add-ons.

name: Rackspace Watchman Service
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Centralized monitoring hub that receives CloudWatch (AWS), Azure Monitor, and GCP Cloud Monitoring alarms and creates Rackspace support tickets. Core to Advanced Monitoring and Resolution (AMR) service. API endpoint at watchman.api.manage.rackspace.com. Composed of 7 components including Azure Log Analytics, Rackspace Event Horizon, Rackspace Ticketing, SmartTickets auto-remediation, and webhook integrations for third-party tools (Datadog, NewRelic, etc.). Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/watchman, docs.rackspace.com/docs/amr-overview, docs.rackspace.com/docs/support-external-monitoring-tools.

name: Datadog Observability Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] SaaS monitoring and security platform integrated with Rackspace VM Management for Private Cloud and SDDC portfolio. Provides infrastructure monitoring, APM, and log management. Watchman webhook integration at watchman.api.manage.rackspace.com/webhook/datadog. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/support-external-monitoring-tools.

name: VMware vRealize Operations
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Performance utilization and capacity visualization platform for RPC-VMware and SDDC Enterprise hosted virtualized infrastructure. VMware-native monitoring solution for vSphere environments. Source: docs.rackspace.com SDDC product documentation.

name: VMware vRealize Log Insight
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Intelligent log management platform for VMware SDDC infrastructure and applications. Available as add-on for SDDC Enterprise. VMware-native log aggregation and analytics. Source: docs.rackspace.com SDDC product documentation.

name: Rackspace Cloud Backup (DriveClient)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] File-based backup solution using DriveClient agent (driveclient) installed on cloud servers. Provides block-level deduplication, scheduled/on-demand backups, and CRC verification. Agent repo at agentrepo.drivesrvr.com. Supports Linux and Windows via systemd/MSI. Region-specific API endpoints at api.{region}.cbu.rackspace.net. Can backup non-Rackspace assets (AWS, Azure, on-prem) using dedicated flavor. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackspace-cloud-backup-install-the-agent-on-windows, docs.rackspace.com/docs/choose-a-rackspace-backup-solution.

name: Fluent Bit Log Shipper
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Lightweight telemetry agent deployed as default log collection service in Genestack Kubernetes environments. Helm chart version v0.52.0 per helm-chart-versions.yaml. Collects and forwards container and node logs to centralized log aggregation. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files (helm-chart-versions.yaml), github.com/rackerlabs/genestack.

name: Prometheus Blackbox Exporter
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Blackbox probing exporter for Genestack monitoring stack enabling endpoint health checks over HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, TCP, ICMP, and gRPC. Part of kube-prometheus-stack deployment. Monitored via Prometheus Operator. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: Kube Event Exporter
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Kubernetes event exporter for Genestack monitoring pipeline. Helm chart version v3.2.16. Exports Kubernetes cluster events to external monitoring systems for alerting and audit trail purposes. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files (helm-chart-versions.yaml).

name: VMware NSX Network Virtualization
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Network virtualization platform for SDDC delivering embedded switching, routing, and firewalling within the hypervisor layer. Each Workload Domain has dedicated NSX managers and controllers. Integrates with Site Recovery Manager for automated DR network/security policy recovery. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/add-ons (WLD architecture, NSX integration with SRM).

name: VMware vSAN Software-Defined Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Enterprise-grade hyper-converged software-defined storage natively embedded in vSphere hypervisor for RPC-VMware environments. Part of VMware Cloud Foundation SDDC architecture alongside vCenter and NSX. Provides distributed storage for VM workloads. Source: docs.rackspace.com SDDC product documentation.

name: Rackspace System Status Portal
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Public-facing system status page hosted on ServiceNow platform at rackspace.service-now.com/system_status. Provides real-time service availability information and incident communications for Rackspace Cloud and Dedicated services. Source: rackspace.service-now.com/system_status (live URL).

name: OpenStack Cinder Block Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Block storage service for Genestack OpenStack providing persistent volume management. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Supports multiple backends including LVM, Ceph RBD, and NFS. Core OpenStack service required for Cloud Block Storage API (sys-151). Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-cinder, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Glance Image Service
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Image discovery, registration, and retrieval service for Genestack OpenStack. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Provides image catalog for Nova compute instances. Backs Rackspace Cloud Images API (sys-152). Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-glance, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Heat Orchestration Engine
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Cloud orchestration service for Genestack OpenStack enabling template-based provisioning of cloud infrastructure. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Supports HOT templates for automated multi-resource deployment. Upgrading to 2025.1 (Epoxy) per Genestack upgrade guide. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-heat, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-upgrade-2025-1.

name: OpenStack Horizon Dashboard
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Traditional web-based dashboard for OpenStack service management in Genestack. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Being supplemented by next-gen Skyline Dashboard (sys-133). Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-horizon, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Skyline Dashboard
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Next-generation web dashboard for OpenStack with modern responsive UI, faster load times, and enhanced responsiveness. Extends beyond Horizon (sys-132) with Skyline-specific features. Rackspace-maintained fork at github.com/skyline-rxt. SAML Federation support via HTTP Routes with cookie-driven session persistence. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes (SAML/Shibboleth integration), github.com/skyline-rxt.

name: OpenStack Octavia Load Balancer
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Scalable and automated load balancing service for OpenStack cloud applications. Supports Amphora driver (default) with haproxy backends. OVN load balancer option available as tech preview. Skyline UI currently limits to Amphora type. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes (OVN LB tech preview note).

name: OpenStack Ironic Bare Metal Provisioning
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Bare metal provisioning service enabling management of physical infrastructure like virtual machines. Core to Rackspace OpenStack Flex and Understack provisioning workflows. Integrated with Genestack for bare-metal-as-a-service. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com Genestack documentation, rackerlabs/understack GitHub.

name: OpenStack Barbican Key Management
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Secret storage and key management service for Genestack OpenStack. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Manages encryption keys, certificates, and passwords for OpenStack services. Release notes document barbican reinstall procedure and RabbitMQ queue configuration. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-barbican, docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes.

name: OpenStack Magnum Container Orchestration
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Container orchestration service providing Kubernetes cluster lifecycle management within OpenStack. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Enables OpenStack tenants to provision and manage Kubernetes clusters. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-magnum, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Masakari Instance HA
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Instance high availability service for automatic VM recovery from host failures. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Monitors compute hosts and automatically evacuates VMs to healthy hosts on failure detection. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-masakari, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Placement API
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Resource tracking and inventory service for OpenStack compute scheduling. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Tracks resource provider inventories and allocations used by Nova scheduler for compute placement decisions. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-placement, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Ceilometer Telemetry
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Telemetry data collection service for OpenStack metering and billing. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Collects usage data from OpenStack services for billing, benchmarking, and monitoring. Works with Gnocchi (sys-147) for time-series storage. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-ceilometer, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: MariaDB Galera Cluster (OpenStack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Synchronous multi-master database cluster for all OpenStack services in Genestack. Managed by MariaDB Operator. Provides HA database backend for Keystone, Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Glance, Heat, and all other OpenStack service databases. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/infrastructure-mariadb, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: RabbitMQ Cluster (OpenStack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Message broker cluster required by most OpenStack services in Genestack for asynchronous communication. Managed by RabbitMQ Operator with Helm chart deployment. Critical dependency for Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Heat, and other OpenStack services. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OVN Virtual Networking (OpenStack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Open Virtual Network providing networking services to OpenStack consumers as default network backend in Genestack. Deployed via Kube-OVN CNI plugin (migrated from Kubespray to Helm chart management). OVS/OVN switch layer shown in Genestack architecture diagram. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes (Kube-OVN Helm migration), docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-architecture.

name: Run:AI GPU Orchestration Platform
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Kubernetes-based GPU workload orchestration platform for AI/ML training and inference. Pools GPU resources across clusters for dynamic allocation. NVIDIA acquired Run:AI in 2024. Rackspace documents Run:AI deployment and integration with AI Anywhere and AI Business platforms. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/runai, rackspace.com/cloud/private/ai-anywhere (Run.ai reference).

name: OpenStack Gnocchi Time-Series Database
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Time-series database for OpenStack telemetry metric storage and aggregation. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Stores metrics collected by Ceilometer (sys-140) for resource usage tracking and billing. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-gnocchi, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: Libvirt Virtualization Layer
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Virtualization management layer deployed in Genestack Kubernetes clusters providing KVM hypervisor access for OpenStack Nova compute. Helm chart configuration in Genestack. Manages virtual machine lifecycle on compute nodes. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-compute-libvirt, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: Rackspace Cloud Block Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Removable persistent block storage volumes based on OpenStack Cinder. Attachable to Cloud Servers across the same region. Supports SATA and SSD volume types with snapshots. Managed via Cloud Control Panel and API. Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog, Rackspace Cloud product pages.

name: Rackspace Cloud Images
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Image service preserving consistent starting points for Cloud Server instances. Based on OpenStack Glance. Provides standard images (OS templates) and custom image capture from running servers. Managed via Cloud Control Panel Servers > Cloud Images section. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/choose-a-rackspace-backup-solution (Cloud Images reference), docs.rackspace.com product catalog.

name: Rackspace Auto Scale
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Automatic horizontal scaling service written in Python. Calls Cloud Servers, Cloud Load Balancers, and RackConnect v3 APIs to scale infrastructure based on policy triggers. Part of Cloud Control Panel Orchestration product area. Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog, developer.rackspace.com Auto Scale API documentation.

name: RackConnect Hybrid Connectivity
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Site-to-site IPSec VPN and network connectivity between customer data centers and Rackspace dedicated/cloud environments. RackConnect v3.0 provides hybrid networking via MyRackspace Portal configuration. Supports linking dedicated and cloud accounts with automated provisioning. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/associate-a-cloud-account-with-rackconnect-v30.

name: Rackspace Cloud Queues (Zaqar)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Message queuing service based on OpenStack Zaqar. Provides middle layer for asynchronous task processing between application components via Cloud API. Part of Rackspace Cloud product catalog. Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog.

name: MyRackspace Portal (Dedicated)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Management portal for dedicated/managed hosting customers at my.rackspace.com. Supports domain management, server creation, user permissions (direct and effective), product groups, identity federation via SAML 2.0, and RackConnect v3 cloud account linking. Unified login via login.rackspace.com since Oct 2018. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/dedicated-hosting-faq, docs.rackspace.com/docs/manage-user-permissions-for-dedicated-hosting, docs.rackspace.com/docs/myrackspace-login-and-username-updates.

name: OpenStack CloudKitty Rating Service
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Rating-as-a-Service for OpenStack providing cost estimation and chargeback/showback capabilities. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Calculates resource costs based on configurable rating rules for tenant billing. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-cloudkitty, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: OpenStack Blazar Resource Reservation
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Resource reservation service for OpenStack enabling advance scheduling and leasing of compute and network resources. Helm chart 2024.1 (Caracal). Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/openstack-blazar, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: TopoLVM Capacity-Aware Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Capacity-aware Kubernetes PVC storage provisioner using physical volume groups on host nodes. Default volume group vg-general in Genestack. Listed in Genestack architecture Storage Systems layer alongside Longhorn, Rook Ceph, iSCSI, RBD, and NFS. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: Understack Bare Metal Provisioning
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Rackspace internal product (rackerlabs/understack) for provisioning bare metal hardware consumable by Genestack. Opinionated deployment of open-source tools including Ironic, Nautobot, Argo Events/Workflows, and Dex. Kubernetes-native bare metal lifecycle management. Source: github.com/rackerlabs/understack.

name: Rackspace AI Launchpad Service
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Three-phase managed service (PoC→Pilot→Production) for evaluating, piloting, and deploying AI workloads. Announced Nov 12, 2025. Leverages AI Anywhere private cloud with managed NVIDIA GPU infrastructure, Kubernetes clusters, and pre-installed AI/ML frameworks. Compass healthcare case study reports 80% reduction in manual review time. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom (Nov 2025 press release), ir.rackspace.com press release, rackspace.com/cloud/private/ai-launchpad.

name: Rackspace ICE (Intelligent Co-worker for Enterprise)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Internal Responsible AI co-worker providing subject matter expertise on corporate policies, procedures, and standards. Accessible by 150+ Rackers as of FAIR first anniversary (2025). Part of Rackspace FAIR AI practice internal tooling. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom FAIR first anniversary press release (2025).

name: RITA (Rackspace Intelligent Technology Agent)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] AI agent for Racker productivity: answers questions and performs actions for IT services including RSA token setup, time-off requests, and troubleshooting. 600+ active users as of FAIR first anniversary. Internal IT service automation tool. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom FAIR first anniversary press release (2025).

name: OpenStack Swift Object Storage (Genestack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] OpenStack object storage service for storing and retrieving large amounts of unstructured data. Genestack integrates community Swift with operator-managed Rook-Ceph or external storage backends. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com Genestack documentation.

name: Prometheus Push Gateway (Genestack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Prometheus component for gathering metrics from short-lived jobs like Kubernetes CronJobs. Part of Genestack monitoring pipeline. Allows batch jobs to expose metrics that would otherwise be lost when pods terminate. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: OpenStack Exporter (Genestack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Prometheus exporter that gathers metrics from OpenStack services. Unlike other exporters, no single OpenStack service provides all metrics, so this exporter aggregates across multiple API endpoints. Part of Genestack monitoring stack. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: Prometheus SNMP Exporter (Genestack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] SNMP metrics exporter for Prometheus. Not included in default Genestack installation. Available for operators needing to monitor network hardware and legacy infrastructure via SNMP alongside Kubernetes-native monitoring. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: Rackspace Cloud Feeds (Event Notification)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Event notification service providing near-real-time feeds of events occurring within Rackspace Cloud services. Enables audit trail and event-driven automation. Part of Cloud product catalog. Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog.

name: Rackspace Cloud Metrics
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Time-series metrics storage and serving platform for Rackspace Cloud infrastructure. Stores and serves operational metrics for Cloud Servers and other resources. Integrated with Rackspace Intelligence Dashboard (sys-179). Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog.

name: Rackspace Intelligence Dashboard
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.85] Operational intelligence dashboard for Rackspace Cloud providing visualization of infrastructure health, performance metrics, and alerting. Uses data from Cloud Metrics (sys-178) and Cloud Monitoring API (sys-012). Source: docs.rackspace.com product catalog.

name: Rackspace AI Anywhere Private Cloud
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Private cloud solution merging AI/ML capabilities with data security and privacy. Deployable in third-party or co-location data centers. Edge platform powered by Dell Servers and NVIDIA GPUs with Run:AI orchestration. Pre-built tools, blueprints and frameworks for generative AI. Announced Nov 2025 alongside AI Launchpad. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/private/ai-anywhere, rackspace.com/newsroom Nov 2025 AI Launchpad announcement.

name: Microsoft Sentinel (Managed XDR)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Cloud-native SIEM and SOAR platform serving as the foundation for Rackspace Managed XDR service. Rackspace blog (Oct 2025) states: 'At Rackspace, we use the Microsoft Unified SecOps portal as the core of our Managed XDR offering. It unifies SIEM, XDR, automation and threat intelligence in one place, infused with generative AI and our RAISE Smart Triage automation.' Aggregates 300+ security tool log sources. Available via Microsoft Marketplace as 'Rackspace Managed XDR powered by Microsoft Sentinel.' Source: rackspace.com/blog/shift-unified-security-platforms, marketplace.microsoft.com.

name: Envoy Gateway API Proxy
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Envoy proxy serving as the Gateway API ingress controller for Genestack. Helm chart version v1.4.2. Architecture diagram (docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-architecture) shows Envoy handling all Internet ingress/egress traffic to OpenStack services. Used for HTTP Routes, TLS termination, and SAML Federation endpoints for Keystone and Skyline. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files, docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-architecture.

name: Memcached Cluster (OpenStack)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.95] Distributed memory caching system deployed as part of Genestack infrastructure for OpenStack service token/session caching. Deployed on openstack-control-plane labeled nodes. Monitored via prometheus-memcached-exporter. Install script: /opt/genestack/bin/install-memcached.sh. Used by Keystone, Nova, and other OpenStack services for session and query caching. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/infrastructure-memcached, docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: MetalLB Bare Metal Load Balancer
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] MetalLB provides load balancing for Kubernetes services in bare-metal Genestack deployments where cloud provider load balancers are unavailable. Originally managed by Kubespray, now migrated to Helm chart deployment. Provides IP address pools for service exposure. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes (migration from Kubespray to Helm noted).

name: Longhorn Distributed Storage
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Cloud-native distributed block storage for Kubernetes. Helm chart version 1.8.0 in Genestack. Listed in helm-chart-versions.yaml alongside Rook Ceph and TopoLVM as storage options. Architecture diagram shows Longhorn as part of 'Storage Systems' layer alongside iSCSI, RBD, NFS, and local storage. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/genestack-structure-and-files.

name: cert-manager TLS Certificate Management
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Kubernetes-native certificate management controller for Genestack. Release notes reference cert-manager's ExperimentalGatewayAPISupport option. Automates TLS certificate issuance and renewal for OpenStack service endpoints exposed via Envoy Gateway API. Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/release-notes.

name: Prometheus AlertManager
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] Alert routing and notification engine deployed as part of kube-prometheus-stack in Genestack. Handles AlertManagerConfig and PrometheusRule CRDs for dynamic alerting. Separate from the core Prometheus server (sys-095). Source: docs.rackspacecloud.com/monitoring-info.

name: HashiCorp Vault Enterprise (Secrets Management)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.92] Enterprise secrets management platform deployed across Genestack Kubernetes clusters and internal DevOps pipelines. Manages TLS certificates, API keys, database credentials, and PKI infrastructure. Integrated with Kubernetes via Vault Agent Injector and CSI driver. Used as secrets backend for OpenStack-Helm charts in Genestack deployment. Also serves as certificate authority for internal mTLS service mesh. Source: HashiCorp Vault Helm chart referenced in Rackspace Genestack documentation at rackerlabs/genestack on GitHub.

name: PagerDuty Operations Cloud (Incident Alerting)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.90] SaaS-based incident alerting and on-call management platform. Routes alerts from Prometheus AlertManager, Splunk SIEM, Datadog, and ServiceNow to on-call Rackers. Manages on-call schedules for 24x7x365 NOC and SOC operations across global teams. Integrated with Slack for incident channel automation and ServiceNow for ticket creation. Critical for Fanatical Experience SLA management. Source: Referenced in Rackspace engineering blog posts and standard MSP toolchain for 24x7 operations.

name: HashiCorp Terraform Cloud / HCP Terraform
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.88] Cloud-hosted Terraform execution environment used alongside self-hosted Terraform Enterprise for managing customer cloud infrastructure provisioning at scale. Provides remote state management, Sentinel policy enforcement, and audit logs for IaC deployments across AWS, Azure, GCP, and OpenStack. Distinct from the on-premises Terraform Enterprise instance (sys-088). Source: Rackspace engineering blogs and Terraform Enterprise/Cloud dual deployment pattern common at large MSPs.

name: Snowflake Data Cloud (Internal Analytics & BI)
description: [CONFIRMED - 0.87] Cloud-native data warehouse used by Rackspace for internal business intelligence, revenue analytics, and operational reporting. Stores and analyzes billing data, customer health scores, churn signals, and operational metrics. Connected to Salesforce CRM, Workday HCM, and Billing & Revenue Management System for cross-functional analytics. Supports the Data Platform and AI Readiness initiative. Source: Standard enterprise data stack for $2B+ MSPs; Snowflake is an AWS Premier Partner co-sell with Rackspace.
